"Okay Freeman, be adequate!"
"..."
"What the hell does that mean, anyway?"
"I dunno, sounds like something the Vorts would say..."

"Expected value of zero?"
"That was my nickname in Intro to Statistics!"
"Really? Did you score zero on every test?"
"No, but my variance was quite high..."

"There's plenty of room at the bottom"
  -Richard Feynman

"All models are wrong, but some are useful"
  -George Box

"The principle of parsimony, while technically correct, sort of misses the point"
  -William of Ockham, commenting on his razor

"Well, Papa, can you multiply triples?"
"No, I can only add and subtract them."
  -William Rowan Hamilton
